Provided By:: National Association of Asian American Professionals - Seattle
title: NAAAP-Seattle Undergraduate Scholarship Award
Description:: The NAAAP-Seattle Undergraduate Scholarship Award is available to undergraduate students of Asian American and / or Asian Pacific Islander descent.  You must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and be attending a university in the Puget Sound area to be eligible for this award.

Provided By:: National Association of Asian American Professionals - Seattle
title: NAAAP-Seattle Graduate Scholarship Award
Description:: The NAAAP-Seattle Graduate Scholarship Award is available to full - time graduate students of Asian American and / or Asian Pacific Islander descent.  You must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and be attending a university in the Puget Sound area to be eligible for this award.

title: Fantasy Sports Daily Scholarship
Description:: The Fantasy Sports Daily Scholarship is available to students attending an accredited college or university.  You must answer four personal, open-ended, and thought-provoking questions to qualify for this award.

title: College Scholarship Essay Competition
Description:: The College Scholarship Essay Competition is available to prospective or current students attending an accredited college or university.  You must submit a 500 word essay on the following topic: "What steps could lawmakers take to strengthen current laws that are aimed at reducing distracted driving and what additional legal measures could be passed to make our roads safer?"

title: Morehead-Cain Scholarship
Description:: The Morehead-Cain Scholarship is available to high achieving high school seniors who are applying to the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.  You must be nominated by your high school or by an eligible affiliate program to qualify for this award.  Additionally, you must demonstrate leadership, high character and a commitment to an active lifestyle.

title: Discover Student Loans Scholarship
Description:: The Discover Student Loans Scholarship is available to high school seniors and students currently enrolled at an accredited college or university.  You must be 16 years of age or older to qualify for this award.  Winners will be selected at random.

title: Premier Scholarship
Description:: The Premier Scholarship is available to entering freshmen at Oakwood University.  You must have at least a 3.50 GPA and a minimum 22 ACT / 1030 SAT score to be eligible for this award.

title: Prestige Scholarship
Description:: The Prestige Scholarship is available to entering freshmen at Oakwood College.  You must have a minimum 3.25 GPA and a minimum 20 ACT / 950 SAT score to be eligible for this award.

title: Achievement Scholarship - Oakwood University
Description:: The Achievement Scholarship is available to entering freshmen at Oakwood University.  You must have at least a 2.5 GPA and have a minimum 18 ACT / 870 SAT score to be eligible for this award.

title: Incentive Grant - Oakwood University
Description:: The Incentive Grant is available to entering freshmen at Oakwood University.  You must have at least a 2.0 GPA and a minimum 16 ACT / 840 SAT score to be eligible for this award.

title: National Merit Scholarship - Oakwood University
Description:: The National Merit Scholarships are available to entering freshmen at Oakwood University.  You must be either a National Merit Finalist, Semi-Finalist or Commended Scholar to be eligible for these awards.

title: AIA San Diego Scholarship
Description:: The AIA San Diego Scholarship is available to graduate students currently enrolled at NewSchool of Architecture and Design.  You must be in good academic standing, maintain a minimum 3.0 GPA per quarter and be continuously enrolled in a NewSchool graduate architecture program to qualify.  The recipient each year will be considered for a Research Assistant position with the Center for Healthy Environments, which oversees the research activities for the AIA Design and Health Research Consortium.

title: Shear Comfort Scholarship
Description:: The Shear Comfort Scholarship is available to students attending an accredited college or university.  You must be studying engineering, automotive technology, or a similar program related to the automotive industry to qualify for this award.  A 300-600 word essay is required that answers the following question: "In your opinion, what will be the largest technological development in the automotive industry within the next 5-10 years and how do you plan to be a part of it? "

title: Forté Fellowships
Description:: The Forté Fellowships is available to female, first - year MBA students at the University of Pennsylvania, Wharton School.  You must demonstrate exemplary leadership in one or more ways: academic leadership, team leadership, community leadership, or creative leadership.

title: Creators' Scholarship
Description:: The Creators' Scholarship is available to students enrolled at an accredited college or university.  You must submit a 500-700 word essay describing how your creativity will help change the world for the better and how your creativity has helped define who you are to qualify for this award.

title: Arxan Cyber Security Scholarship
Fields of Study:: Cyber Security, Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Software Engineering
Description:: The Arxan Cyber Security Scholarship is available to students enrolled at an accredited college or university.  You must showcase your knowledge, passion and dedication to advancements in the cyber security field to qualify for this award.   Additionally, you must submit a 800 - to 1500 - word essay focused on the topic of application security.

title: eCommerce Entrepreneur Scholarship
Description:: The eCommerce Entrepreneur Scholarship is available to students enrolled at an accredited college or university.  You must demonstrate a strong interest in starting an online business after (or during) your college career to qualify for this award.  Students with an interest in eCommerce who are studying any discipline are encouraged to apply.  A 750-1000 word essay is also required.

title: Mas Family Scholarship
Fields of Study:: Engineering, Business, International Relations, Economics, Communications, Journalism
Description:: The Mas Family Scholarship is available to undergraduate and graduate students majoring in the fields of engineering, business, international relations, economics, communications and journalism.  You must be a direct descendant of those who left Cuba or have been born in Cuba yourself to be considered for this award.  Selection will be based on academic performance, leadership qualities, and the potential to contribute to the advancement of a free society.  A minimum 3.5 GPA and at least a 1000 SAT score are required.  You must also demonstrate financial need and submit two short essays to qualify.

title: Get-Frontier.com Scholarship
Description:: The Get-Frontier.com Scholarship is available to undergraduate students enrolled at an accredited college or university.  You must submit an essay of between 600 and 1000 words explaining the argument that internet access is a right to qualify for this award.  A minimum 2.5 GPA is also required.

title: Academic Scholarship
Description:: The Academic Scholarship is available to full-time undergraduate students at Olivet Nazarene University.  You must meet both the minimum GPA and test score requirements listed on the sponsor's website to be eligible for this renewable award.

title: Athletic Merit Scholarship
Description:: The Athletic Merit Scholarship is available to students at Olivet Nazarene University.  You must be involved in athletics and demonstrate skill and ability in order to be eligible for this award.

title: Transfer Academic Scholarship
Description:: The Transfer Academic Scholarship is available to full-time undergraduate students transferring into Olivet Nazarene University.  You must have completed at least 16 college credit hours with a minimum GPA of 3.0 to be eligible for this renewable award.

title: Transfer Academic Grant
Description:: The Transfer Academic Grant is available to full-time undergraduate students transferring into Olivet Nazarene University.  You must have completed at least 16 college credit hours with a minimum GPA of 2.0 to be eligible for this renewable award.

title: Phi Theta Kappa Transfer Scholarship
Description:: The Phi Theta Kappa Transfer Scholarship is available to undergraduate students transferring into Olivet Nazarene University.  You must be a Phi Theta Kappa member to be eligible for this renewable award.

title: Army ROTC Scholarship
Description:: The Army ROTC Scholarship is available to freshman and sophomore students at Olivet Nazarene University.  You must be an active member of the Army ROTC in order to qualify for this award.

title: Veteran Benefits/Yellow Ribbon Program
Description:: The Veteran Benefits/Yellow Ribbon Program is available to students at Olivet Nazarene University.  You must be a veteran of military service in order to qualify for this award.
